info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 02 at 8:46PM EDT until July 02 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN POLK AND NORTHEASTERN GREENVILLE COUNTIES... At 846 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles south of Columbus, or 5 miles southwest of Landrum, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Tryon, Tigerville, Pleasant Ridge State Park, Glassy Mountain, North Saluda Reservoir and Gowensville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
